localcopy.rightLabel: Enable file copy of standard files
helpers: Rather than using FTP simply copy the standard web files to another folder.
Typically this would be used when 'self hosting', when FTP/PHP upload would not be appropriate/efficient.
It can be used in conjunction with FTP.

localcopyfolder.label: Local copy destination folder path:
localcopyfolder.helper: Enter the folder name to which you wish to copy the standard files, this should have a trailing '/' or '\'
localcopyfolder.placeholder: Destination path with trailing folder delimiter

helpers: Enable web site uploads via FTP, FTPS, SFTP, or PHP

sslftp.label: Select the Upload Protocol to use:
sslftp.helper: Select the protocol required by your web host

hostname.label: Host name:
hostname.helper: Enter the host name of the remote FTP server. Leaving this blank also suppresses all FTP activities.

phpurl.label: Upload URL:
phpurl.helper: Enter the URL of the upload script on your server

ftpport.label: FTP port:
helpers: Enter the FTP port to use. Common defaults are: FTP=21, FTPS=21(990*), SFTP=22
* Port 990 is used when the older Implicit FTPS is configured

sshAuth.label: SFTP Authentication method:
sshAuth.helper: Select the authentication method for SFTP connections

pskFile.label: Pre-shared Private Key file for SFTP:
pskFile.helper: Filename for your private PSK file, include the full path if the file is not in your CumulusMX folder

phpsecret.label: PHP Upload Secret:
helpers: Enter a complex string used to generate PHP upload signatures.
Cumulus will generate a unique string for you.
You will need to enter this string into the webfiles/upload.php file before uploading it to your web site
Use this if your FTP server supports it (most do)
It minimises the time the file will be unavailable to your web server
Use this only if your FTP server requires it (most do not)
It deletes the destination file before uploading the new version
Use UTF-8 encoding for the standard files. This is the normal standard.

phpignorecerts.label: Certificates
helpers: Not normally required - use with caution
Typically only used if you are connecting to your own internal web server and it does not have a public certificate

phpuseget.label: GET uploads
phpuseget.rightLabel: Use GET for PHP small file uploads
helpers: Some web servers do not seem to work well with GET uploads, if you experience issues with the small uploads (realtime.txt etc) then this option can be disabled
Disabling this option will make small uploads slightly slower

maxuploads.label: Concurrent Uploads
helpers: Set the maximum number of concurrent PHP uploads allowed to your web server
Changing this setting requires a restart of CMX to take effect
Defaults: Windows=4, Mono=1

stdwebsite.rightLabel: I want to use the supplied default web site
helpers: WARNING: Ticking this WILL overwrite any existing settings you may have saved, if you set this, please double check all your settings below
Enabling this will automatically enable all the required options below
Disabling this WILL automatically DISABLE all the required options below
You will still need to save the configuration after setting this option
This switch setting is not saved, it is just a switch to configure the defaults for the standard web site. It overwrites any settings you may already have set

ftpinterval.label: Interval time:
ftpinterval.helper: Interval between web updates in minutes

enableintervalftp.label: Upload
enableintervalftp.helper: Select this to have Cumulus enable uploading files at the web update interval

realtimeinterval.label: Real time interval
realtimeinterval.helper: Interval between real time updates in seconds

enablerealtimeftp.label: Upload:
enablerealtimeftp.helper: FTP: Establishes the real time connection so that uploads can take place at the real time interval

server.label: Server Name:
server.helper: The hostname (and domain) or IP address of your SMTP server

port.label: Network Port:
port.helper: The SMTP port used by your SMTP server

ssloption.label: Use SSL/TLS:
helpers: Select the protocol required by your email server:
None - No SSL or TLS encryption will be used
Auto - Cumulus decides which TLS/unencrypted options to use (default). Use this option unless you have good reason not to
TlsOnConnect - The connection should use TLS encryption immediately
StartTls - Use TLS encryption immediately. If the server does not support the STARTTLS extension then the connection will fail
StartTlsWhenAvailable - use TLS encryption immediately, but only if the server supports the STARTTLS extension

ignorecerterrors.label: Certificate errors:
ignorecerterrors.helper: Caution: Forces the email client to ignore any errors when checking the servers security certificate, this is not normally required

authenticate.label: Authentication:
authenticate.helper: Does your SMTP server require username/password authentication

user.label: Username:
user.helper: The username to connect to your SMTP server

password.label: Password:
password.helper: The password used to authenticate with your SMTP server

program.label: Interval program:
program.helper: A program or command to be run at each web update interval

programparams.label: Interval program parameters:
programparams.helper: Parameters for the above program or command, this can contain web tags

realtimeprogram.label: Real time program:
realtimeprogram.helper: A program or command to be run at each real time interval

realtimeprogramparams.label: Real time program parameters:

dailyprogram.label: Daily program:
dailyprogram.helper: A program or command to be run at the start of each day

dailyprogramparams.label: Daily program parameters:
dailyprogramparams.helper: Parameters for the above program or command, this can contain web tags
